result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:27 PM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquayl Wayne Laray Shields appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Marquayl Wayne Laray Shields. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders $500 Cash Bond with conditions: Absolute sobriety. No driving without a valid license or insurance.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid license or insurance.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
